SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

Class Headers

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<Header>
java.util.AbstractList<Header>
java.util.ArrayList<Header>
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.Headers
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Header>, Collection<Header>, List<Header>, RandomAccess, SequencedCollection<Header>
public class Headers extends ArrayList<Header>
A collection of HTTP headers with convenience methods for header access. Headers are stored in order and support case-insensitive name lookup.
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Headers

      public Headers()
      Creates an empty headers collection.

    • Headers

      public Headers(int initialCapacity)
      Creates a headers collection with the specified initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - the initial capacity

    • Headers

      public Headers(Collection<? extends Header> headers)
      Creates a headers collection containing the headers from the specified collection.
      Parameters:
      headers - the collection of headers to copy

  • Method Details

    • getValue

      public String getValue(String name)
      Returns the value of the first header with the specified name. Header name matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      the header value, or null if no header with that name exists

    • getValues

      public List<String> getValues(String name)
      Returns all values for headers with the specified name. Header name matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      a list of header values (may be empty, never null)

    • getHeader

      public Header getHeader(String name)
      Returns the first header with the specified name. Header name matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      the header, or null if no header with that name exists

    • getHeaders

      public List<Header> getHeaders(String name)
      Returns all headers with the specified name. Header name matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      a list of headers (may be empty, never null)

    • containsName

      public boolean containsName(String name)
      Returns true if a header with the specified name exists. Header name matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      true if the header exists

    • add

      public boolean add(String name, String value)
      Adds a header with the specified name and value. This is a convenience method equivalent to add(new Header(name, value)).
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      value - the header value
      Returns:
      true (as specified by Collection.add)

    • set

      public void set(String name, String value)
      Sets a header, replacing any existing headers with the same name. Header name matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      value - the header value

    • removeAll

      public boolean removeAll(String name)
      Removes all headers with the specified name. Header name matching is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      true if any headers were removed

    • getCombinedValue

      public String getCombinedValue(String name)
      Returns a comma-separated string of all values for the specified header name. This is useful for headers like Accept that may appear multiple times or have comma-separated values.
      Parameters:
      name - the header name
      Returns:
      comma-separated values, or null if no headers with that name exist

    • status

      public void status(HTTPStatus status)
      Sets the :status pseudo-header for a response. This is a convenience method for setting the HTTP status code.
      Parameters:
      status - the HTTP status

    • getMethod

      public String getMethod()
      Returns the HTTP method from the :method pseudo-header.
      Returns:
      the HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.), or null if not present

    • getPath

      public String getPath()
      Returns the request path from the :path pseudo-header.
      Returns:
      the request path, or null if not present
